thread.title: 22 Things You'll Only Understand If Your BFF Is An Extrovert, But You’re An Introvert
thread.title_full: 22 Things You'll Only Understand If Your BFF Is An Extrovert, But You’re An Introvert

author: Christopher Hudspeth, Farrah Penn
title: 22 Things You'll Only Understand If Your BFF Is An Extrovert, But You’re An Introvert
text:
View this image › 
Facebook / Via Facebook: uniladmag ID: 10758147 2. They have methods of persuading you, like trying to hype you up. View this image › 
ABC ID: 10758778 3. Or trying to make you feel guilty when you’re reluctant to go out. View this image › 
NBC ID: 10758277 4. But even if they get you to attend, they know that doesn’t mean you’ll be staying there all night. View this image › 
NBC ID: 10758558 5. You’re open to the idea of trying new things with them, but they know you’re more comfortable having one-on-one time with them in a pair of sweats. View this image › 
NBC ID: 10758211 6. Sometimes you make up slang terms that sound fun to convince them to stay in with you. View this image › 
ABC ID: 10758242 7. And just because you’re staying in doesn’t mean you can’t show the world how much of a good time y’all are having on social media. View this image › 
Fox ID: 10758649 8. You understand their constant desire for communication and attempt to be better at rapidly responding. View this image › 
NBC ID: 10758190 9. However, there are times when you “forget” to reply to their texts — but because you’re so close they have no problem confronting you about it. View this image › 
USA ID: 10758424 10. They understand your hatred toward little things, like huge crowds and people who try and talk to you before you’ve had coffee. View this image › 
NBC ID: 10758302 11. Sometimes your brain can’t fully process every detail that’s on their mind and you find your thoughts wandering elsewhere. View this image › 
NBC ID: 10758198 12. There are occasions where you’re on the way to meet your BFF, but then they inform you that more people who you don’t know are coming too. View this image › 
ID: 10758683 13. They’ve learned to accept your weird excuses when you turn down social obligations. View this image › 
NBC ID: 10758310 14. As well as your incredibly vague answers to the question, “What are you doing?” View this image › 
Netflix ID: 10758351 15. But they’re always pleasantly surprised when you DO hit them up and say you want to go out. View this image › 
Bravo / Via reactiongifs.com ID: 10758343 16. However, they’re not surprised when you’re over it after being out for 30 minutes. View this image › 
FOX ID: 10758930 17. Sometimes they’ll want to take you out to meet new people, but then they’re over it within 20 minutes. View this image › 
VH1 ID: 10758414 18. They’re ALWAYS willing to dish out hours of advice when you need it. View this image › 
ABC ID: 10758370 19. But they also know you’re a really great listener, so you’re the first person they turn to when they need advice. View this image › 
ABC ID: 10758419 20. If something comes up and they have to cancel plans on you, you’re more than happy to stay in and relax. View this image › 
USA ID: 10758442 21. Ultimately you have a love/hate relationship with the way they push you out of your comfort zone. View this image › 
Netflix ID: 10758597 22. But at the end of the day, whether the two of you are staying in or going out, it always has potential to be a great time. View this image › 
Facebook / Via Facebook: uniladmag ID: 10759108 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
